We had just declined dessert and the check appeared and as soon as we paid it he started removing the water glasses and carafe. Then as soon as we put our napkins on the table preparatory to leaving he came and scooped them up. When we left it appeared only a few people were waiting and  there was an empty table by us. My friends commented on the rude ejection. So the restaurant lost 2 new prospects who were offended and I won't be coming back.
author: Ann W.

description: New restaurant and we had to try it.  Very cool place, don't miss the kitchen/bar seating in the back .  Still getting their service and timing down but the food was fantastic, atmosphere was great and located in the Presidio it was very convenient.  It will definitely be a hot spot for years to come.  Try the corn on the cob, it's soooo different and just great.  4 stars just because they are still a little in the learning curve on service, details, etc.  I am sure they will be 5 stars soon!!!
author: David P.

description: Food is exceptional- just right portions and wonderful purity in taste. The veggies are always done to perfection. Our 4th time here, we always sit at the seats around the kitchen. Love to chat with those preparing the food who seem to enjoy what they do. One thing that is sad to see is that when the head chef arrives the ambience changes for the worse--he creates tension in the kitchen. That is hard to watch as everyone seems to be very conscientious about their work. Would give 5 stars...otherwise. Love the hygienic practices. More vegan dishes please.
author: June C.

description: Ignore the negative reviews, this place is AWESOME! We came on a Wednesday night with no reservation and they were totally accommodating! We sat at the communal table and got to see all the coming and goings of the kitchen, so fun! The food was outstanding! Brussel sprouts, shrimp, potatoes, trout all cooked to perfection! Our server, Ryan, was friendly professional and so attentive! The only reason for the four versus five star review is that somehow our order got overlooked and we ended up waiting a LONG time for our food! Nonetheless our server Ryan more than made up for it by communicating effectively and buying us wine, which never hurts! I work in the presidio and get tired of the marina 'food grind'. This is a fantastic alternative to the overpriced and often unfriendly restaurant's in the marina. And there's parking!!! Honestly, this place is stellar so give it a try! You surely won't be disappointed!
author: stephanie c.

description: Beautiful location in the Presidio and I like the open kitchen in the back. You can taste the quality of product in the food, but overall it's over-priced for what you get. The flavors are solid, but not exceptional.  I've had dinner and lunch here as well as attended a couple of little parties. The service is only ok. The prices of grab and go foods are a little horrendous. $12 for a small tuna sandwich is just too much. I'm hoping all these things work themselves out once they have been up and running for a while.
author: Katie M.

description: I was very excited to try this restaurant and it took a while to get a good reservation time.  The service is very good.  The staff is all very friendly, helpful, and knowledgable.  The food is good, but not great.  The sweet pea and ham croquetas were tasty.  The pork albondigas (meatballs) looked much better than they tasted, and they were fairly dry which is odd since one of mine was raw in the middle.  The little gem salad, manchego, cured anchovy, fried bread was tasty, but overdressed... nothing special.  The lamb shoulder, candied eggplant, farro, and chermoula was the really very good, and the jamon wrapped trout, trumpet mushrooms, sherry, and tarragon was OK.  Overall, I'd probably go back, but I won't be rushing there.
author: Garrett H.

description: The Commissary delivered a wonderful five course New Year celebration dinner with awesome wine pairings. The best part was sitting at the kitchen bar and watching the staff in action. Talented people preparing and serving. What a delight!
author: Francine V.

description: Our first time and we will be back. We went for an early dinner of appetizers and small plates and they were well prepared and presented well. Our server was professional and friendly, though another man who seemed to be roaming and encroaching on our server, was a bit obsequious. One complaint: get real wine glasses! This trend of serving wine in tumblers has got to stop! It really does affect the wine.
author: Carol H.

description: I thought eating back on the bar by the kitchen was the highlight of the evening. It was really up close and you could watch how they prepare everything very nice. Food was prepared very well the highlight dish was the corn on the cob. My only negative thought was I brought a really nice bottle of Pinot and you drink in glasses that were little bit bigger than custard cups. It didn't do justice to the wine. Very nice dining experience
author: Bob M.

description: Great service and the decor and ambiance was very nice. My boyfriend and I started off with two tapas and followed with an entrée each which was more than enough food for the both of us. Cod fritters were delicous, the lamb was nice and tender and the trout wraped in ham was amazing. Save room for dessert!
author: Karla O.

description: The service at The Commissary is superb.  Now if only the food matched the service.  Overall food is so so.  I've been to Spain and the food at The Commissary was not even close.  Your chef needs to work on flavor.  At this time I would not recommend.  Coffee was not hot.  Lukewarm coffee is not my idea of good coffee.  Desserts need more work.  The "ice cream" on the chocolate soufflé ?????
author: Merry N.

description: My steak was cold and the service was as bad as I've had in a long time. I would not recommend this place.
author: Jud B.

description: First rate. One of the best meals in SF. Elegant and informal. Food had perfect seasoning. Great service. Plan to back again frequently
author: Jeff G.

description:
What a disappointment. It was my birthday, I am a Traci des Jardins fan and I am former military and love the Presidio. I had a friend in town and with my husband and son we went there for an 8pm reservation. Place is beautiful. We waited around 8 minutes at the door--no one was around and servers walked by and ignored us. 
We were seated and the server arrived. He was sweating profusely and in a hurry. We ordered drinks and 3 appetizers. 3 of us ordered wine which was maybe a 2 oz pour--at 14.00/glass this was ridiculously expensive. We had to ask 3 times for our last appetizer. Our table was not cleared before the next courses. We had to repeatedly ask for water.We had 4 different servers--Food was fine but not for the amount charged of 250.00. Please Traci
1, train your staff
2. pour a glass of wine that is worth 14.00
3. Realize it would not take much to make this a super place to eat--just refinement
Thank you
author: Lori W.

description: Had lunch with a friend after a hike in the Presidio. Juicy hamburger, crisp fries, perfectly dressed arugula salad, friendly and efficient service. I'm looking forward to returning repeatedly post hike and eating lunch on the porch where my hiking companion, my chocolate Labrador can join me.  Wonderful addition to the Presidio.
author: Rami R.

description: Living by the presidio we're always excited when a new spot opens in the park, and The Commissary did not disappoint. It's hard to pick one highlight from delicious fish, to perfectly done steak, to even grilled octopus my Gallego grandfather would have recommended. The decor is modest yet modern and the staff is friendly and helpful. If you enjoy food for it's taste and don't require some grand display of luxury The Commissary will serve you well.
author: Michael L.

description: Decent food marred by very bad service, and disjointed kitchen staff. Needs help in staffing department.
author: Bruce W.

description: Beautiful setting for an attractively designed restaurant. Menu is creative and food very well prepared. We found the service to be exceptionally fine. Would definitely return for another meal.
author: Phyllis S.

description: A most amazing evening at The Commissary -- we reserved their private room for family birthday party and could not have had a better time.  Rave reviews for the atmosphere, the incredible food, and the wonderful service.  Chef Traci Des Jardins even stopped by to say hello!!!!  I can't say enough positive things about our perfect dinner at the Commissary.  Special thanks to the Chef and to wonderful service management from Ashton and Malcolm.
author: F W.

description: Second visit to the Commissary and more impressed than the first time. The cheese board had plums and pears along with the cheese and sausage- the perfect bite with a glass of white wine. The Octopus was the dinner hit this visit, but the pot of potatoes that was served with the steak was the next best side to the corn, yum! Service at the kitchen table was great and watching the chefs cook is just theater.
author: Jon M.

description: Great food. Good service. Very well done interior, but meant to be casual, not formal.Yelp res service went without hitch. Sound was especially good.- as in audibly conversational.
author: Ludwig T.

description: Dinner there was fabulous!   Everything was delicious and service and atmosphere were top notch.   Favorite dishes were the octopus, clams, gazpacho, and chickpea galetta.   Chef Robbie Lewis and his team have created a gem in the Presidio.  Will have to sit at the Chef's table next table next time to take in the action and enjoy an incredibly palatable meal.   Highly recommend!
author: J T.

description:
My family and I ate here on Saturday and had a fantastic experience from start to finish. I was able to make a large party reservation just a couple of days in advance and then they were even able to accommodate our reservation when I asked to push it back 2 hours later the day of...and we got to sit at one of the chef's tables (we lucked out big time but the reservationist and restaurant staff were all very friendly and patient)! The entrance is very discrete but once inside the restaurant itself is beautiful and spacious- there is actually breathing room between every table! I loved everything about the interior design and ambiance. We were seated in the back room with a view of the open kitchen. If I wasn't with a group of 6, I would have loved to sit at one of the bar seats with prime viewing of the chefs at work. The whole place and experience reminded me of Michelin-star restaurant Relae in Copenhagen.

Onto the absolute best part: THE FOOD. We ordered almost everything off the menu! The Ham and Pea croquettes are to die for - there are whole peas in every croquette! Cod Fritters, Aboldingas...it's aaaalll good. As for entrees, we tried the chickpea 'pancake' (they had a better name for it but I can't remember it right now), the trout, the steak and the chicken. All very delicious and perfectly cooked but the chicken (with marcona almonds and dates) and the trout stood out in my mouth. 

Drinks are awesome- if you can, ask the owner for the story behind each name. Speaking of the owner, he was awesome. He was a big reason for making our experience so enjoyable...but also the food, and the cocktails. I've eaten at a lot of Bay Area restaurants and this one is at the top of my list. I look forward to coming back for Brunch or take out for a picnic on the lawn in front of the restaurant!

Thanks for a wonderful meal!
author: Avery M.

description: Our family enjoyed an excellent meal and cocktails, we will come again. Loved the crunchy corn on the cob!!!
author: Marianne M.

description: Food was hit and miss: some dishes fairly bland, others nicely done.  Service was very good, atmosphere great although I'm not a fan of communal tables - when I go out to dinner, I like to focus on the people I came with.  All in all, disappointing for the price etc.  I will give it another shot as I like the Presidio/ space, but food quality needs to improve/consistent for me to be a regular and get rid of the communal tables!
author: jeff w.

description: I have never written a negative yelp review before, but I have never been told by a maitre d'  "There's nothing here for you" and refused service!  BTW, I'm 67 and that means a lot of meals in restaurants, but this was a brand new experience.  We arrived at 7:30 and were told that they were setting up our table and to wait at the bar.  We stood at the bar for half an hour and checked back and were told again that they were setting up our table.  After waiting 50 minutes, I said the "Yelp" word.  The manager gave us a small glass of champagne.  Still no table.  We suggested that he comp the people at the table with  coffee or dessert at the bar.  He said he had never heard of anything so rude.  Finally, after an hour, he came back with menus and I said, "Do you have a table?" And he said, "No.  I don't think there's anything here for you.  There are other restaurants nearby."  So, we can't rate the food, but we can rate the service:   "Never again."  It's a peculiar experience because we've eaten at their other restaurant, Jardiniere, and had nothing but raves about it.  I thought maybe that they were  still working things out in their reservations department, but since I see other comments on the long wait, perhaps it's not unusual.   Happily, the manager is correct--there are lots of other good restaurants nearby!
author: niko m.

description: Really enjoyed the appetizer of grilled peppers and the chicken was exceptional.  Easy parking, great location, atmosphere, service.  Portions in some cases a bit small.
author: Yella W.

description: Hi, I guess this would be called a mixed review.  Pluses:  great service, nice waiter, interesting food, good cocktails. But our biggest complaint is that we couldn't read the menu.  We spent at least 7-8 minutes asking the waiter to translate various terms and expressions.  My husband took 6 years of Spanish, and couldn't recognize many of the words, so unless you're a native Spanish speaking food critic, I'm not sure the menu will be useful for you either.  Do you remember how to say 'anchovies', 'bread crumbs', or 'obscure type of cheese' in Spanish?  Neither did he.  And these words are mixed in with English, but you still have no idea what you're ordering.  I ended up ordering two salads (there are no distinct categories here and they frown on the word 'lettuce'), so my husband shared part of my second salad.  I asked the waiter what the point of this menu was (twice), and he never answered.  They're trying too hard to be edgy at the price of clarity.  Btw, the menu on the website isn't exactly like the one we got.
author: Anna G.

description: I am very torn. I really wanted to like this place, but would go back to give it another chance. The food was a bit hit and miss. I really enjoyed the the clams, cuttlefish and I thought the peach salad was very well done. Now pork albondigas and sweet pea and ham croquetas both served cold, if they were hot I think they could have been good. The octopus had a bit too much lemon and thicker pieces would have been nice. I think my biggest issue is service. We were greeted a couple of times by 1 server but that server never came back to take our order which is ok. Server #2 came by answered a few questions and got order. He never came back to check on the food while we were eating. He did checked but after we were just about done. Never refilled our water or wine or maybe once towards the end. I watched him clear another table and as he was walking to the kitchen he dropped a knife it made a pretty loud noise and what shocked me was he walked back and never picked up the knife he just left it by the guest's feet and no one else made an effort either. Just surprised for a restaurant by Traci. I hope they work out the kinks soon.
author: Hawaii t.

description: So 2.5 out of 3 stars are for the location. It's so nice to go to dinner "outside of the city" without leaving the city. Gotta love the Presido. Because of the location, I think this place would be GREAT for brunch. BUT, location is not everything, and sadly, I likely won't be coming back to this restaurant anytime soon for the food, or for the drinks at that. I came here with a friend and we ate at the chefs table (or whatever they called the wrap around bar surrounding the kitchen). If there's only 2 of you, sit here, it's great. Sitting in front of the pastry chef making desserts all night(most popular were the churros) was a treat, and we "treated" ourselves to the churros naturally. To start, I had the "Wett Mutt" cocktail which basically tasted like straight up Gin. Undrinkable, had to send it back. We ordered the sausage and cheese plate, pork albondigas, and sweet pea and ham croquetas to start. The sweet pea croqueta was delish(anything fried is good). For entrees, we had the chickpea galetta(vegetarian option) and a fish option. The galettas were too dry with a creamy something that really had no flavor. The fish was also quite average/bland. The churros, however were YUMMY. Dipped in chocolate and a delicious latte to wash it down, were the highlights of the meal. Service was totally decent and I loved the restaurant space.  It's worth trying at least once, again, for the location. Lunch and then some Disney museum action would be a great way to spend the day.
author: Courtney G.
